US-001B.title: Role-Based Access Control and Audit Logging
acceptance_criteria: Audit log captures all property operations (create, update, delete, publish)
Audit log records: who (user), what (action), when (timestamp), where (IP), how (user agent)
Properties table tracks created_by, updated_by, published_by
System user exists for automated imports (system@bestays.app)
Database migration creates audit_log table with proper indexes
Database migration adds audit fields to properties table (or creates if doesn't exist)
SQLAlchemy models created for AuditLog and Property
Migration is reversible (downgrade works correctly)
Proper foreign key constraints and cascading behavior
Migration tested locally (upgrade and downgrade)
Models follow project patterns (file headers, type hints)
Database indexes optimized for query patterns

US-001.title: Login Flow Validation and Documentation
acceptance_criteria: Login form loads consistently within 2 seconds on all browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari)
Clerk sign-in component mounts successfully 100% of the time (no blank screen)
After successful Clerk authentication:
Error handling displays user-friendly messages for:
File Headers Added:
E2E tests cover:
Storybook stories created:
All quality checks pass:

US-017.title: SDLC Branch Naming Validation
acceptance_criteria: GIT_WORKFLOW.md documents correct branch naming pattern (`{type}/TASK-XXX-US-XXX`)
Branch validation script correctly validates all current branches as valid
Branch validation script rejects invalid patterns with clear error messages
Pre-tool-use hook calls branch validation before git checkout operations
Validation script supports all valid types (feat, fix, refactor, test, docs, chore)
Validation script handles edge cases (main branch, hotfix branches if applicable)
Hook provides actionable error messages with correct pattern examples
Validation is fast (<100ms) to avoid slowing down workflow
All validation logic has unit tests (>90% coverage)
Integration tests verify hook blocks invalid branch names
Documentation is clear, with examples of valid and invalid patterns
CLAUDE.md updated with clarified branching section

US-001D.title: Extend docs-stories Skill with Context Indexing

US-001E.title: SDLC Orchestrator Skill (Coordinator Brain)
acceptance_criteria: Skill provides clear guidance for each of 5 SDLC phases (RESEARCH, PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION, TESTING, VALIDATION)
Each phase section includes: objectives, required actions, required outputs, quality checks, next phase
Planning phase explicitly references all 7 planning quality gates
Implementation phase explicitly lists which subagents to spawn for which work
Phase transition logic includes validation checklist
SKILL.md follows claude-skill-manager guidelines (YAML frontmatter, imperative voice, progressive disclosure)
Skill references existing skills (docs-stories, planning-quality-gates, research-git-patterns, frontend-svelte)
Skill references Memory MCP entities to load
Skill integrates with task STATE.json (phase field)
references/phase-checklists/ provide detailed checklists for each phase (optional but recommended)
Test orchestrator skill on US-001D implementation (use it to guide through phases)
Verify all 7 planning quality gates are mentioned in planning phase
Verify coordinator role boundaries are clear (spawn subagents, never implement directly)
Verify skill is discoverable (YAML frontmatter with good description)
Document skill in CLAUDE.md as part of SDLC infrastructure
Skill works with slash commands (/task-research, /task-plan, /task-implement)
Skill references docs-stories for task state updates
Skill references planning-quality-gates for planning phase
Skill integrates with Memory MCP (load entities before planning)
Skill produces outputs that work with context indexer (US-001D)
